channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Olympic Day
item.description:
Sunday, June 23, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Olympic Colours to recognise Olympic Day.

Olympic Day is celebrated all around the world on 23 June, in global celebration of the founding of the International Olympic Committee and the modern Olympic Movement in 1894.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Routine testing
item.description:
Monday, June 24, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit for routine testing.

The Story Bridge decorative lighting will undergo routine testing on Monday 24 June 2024, between 5-8pm.

During this time, the Bridge will change through multiple colours and patterns before returning to the City of Brisbane colours of blue and gold once complete.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Melbourne
item.description:
Wednesday, June 26, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game II Melbourne.

With the Mighty Maroons winning Game I in the 2024 Ampol State of Origin Series in Sydney, will they take out their 3rd consecutive series in Melbourne tonight or will we go to a decider at Suncorp. Gear up in your Maroon and get ready to cheer your team.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: PTSD Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 27, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support PTSD Awareness Day.

Phoenix Australia are experts in trauma-related mental health and wellbeing. For 25 years, we have been Australia’s National Centre of Excellence in Posttraumatic Mental Health and internationally recognised leaders in our field. We are committed to driving forward the mental health agenda both at home and abroad. This June 27 marks PTSD Awareness Day in Australia, a day dedicated to raising awareness and understanding of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).

This Light Up is organised by: Phoenix Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Friday, June 28, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

Take a moment to reflect on your myasthenia journey. Capture the image and share so myasthenia can gain more awareness in the community. This will help research. This will help you with your myasthenia journey.
"Queensland Lights Up for Myasthenia" celebrates International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 105th anniversary of Zonta International
item.description:
Saturday, June 29, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to celebrate the 105th anniversary of Zonta International.

Celebrating their 105th year in 2024, Zonta International has more than 1,100 clubs with over 27,000 members in sixty-four countries and is renowned for its strong advocacy of women’s rights while using their individual and collective expertise in service to their community. The three core campaign messaging of NO to violence against women, YES to gender equality and NOW to climate change. The Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc, the local member of Zonta International, focuses on its human rights mission of empowering women, supporting girls and young women with education, clothing and basic health and hygiene products, and promoting the achievements of women in industry including science, aeronautics, technology, and business.

This light up is organised by Brisbane Economic Development Agency and Zonta International. 

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: 2024 Queens Ball
item.description:
Saturday, June 29, 2024

City Hall will be lit Rainbow LGBTIQ+ to support 2024 Queens Ball.

The 2024 Queens Ball Awards celebrates 63 years of celebrating and recognising LGBTIQ+ people achievements and serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride Festival, raising vital funds to better the mental health and the well-being of the LGBTIQ+ communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival Inc.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Canada National Day
item.description:
Monday, July 1, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and White to recognise Canada National Day.

Canada Day is the National day of Canada, marking the country’s confederation on the 1st of July 1867. 2024 is also the Centenary Year of the Royal Canadian Air Force. As part of these Centenary celebrations, the Royal Canadian Air Force wishes to celebrate this day with Brisbane citizens who have a Canadian connection, and with Australians, who are one of Canada's closest historical allies, as they start their second Century of service.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Canadian Air Force.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Le Festival
item.description:
Friday, July 5, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to celebrate 2024 Le Festival.

Le Festival 2024 is will be Le Festival's biggest French cultural celebration yet, inspired by the Paris 2024 Olympic Games which provide an optimal platform to create a French cultural experience and facilitate a cultural exchange to a new level. This is a unique opportunity to highlight the French culture, and leverage the Franco-Australian connection even further through creating a virtual bridge Paris - Brisbane. In a year where France is in the spotlight, the world is turning 'bleu-blanc-rouge' and Brisbane is no exception.

This Light Up is organised by: Le Festival.

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Brisbane Open House
item.description:
Saturday, July 6, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to celebrate Brisbane Open House.

Brisbane Open House (BOH) is a free annual event providing residents and visitors with the rare opportunity to discover the hidden wealth of architecture, engineering and history in buildings and places around Brisbane city. Selected buildings are open to the public with guided and self-guided tours encouraging visitors to explore, re-examine and engage with Brisbane’s built environment. The experience opens people’s eyes and minds to good design and curious spaces.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Open House Ltd.

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: NAIDOC Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 7, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to recognise NAIDOC Week.

In the first week of July each year, National NAIDOC Week celebrations are held across Australia to celebrate and recognise the history, culture, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC stands for National Aborigines and Islanders Day Observance Committee. NAIDOC Week is an opportunity for all Australians to learn about Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and histories and participate in celebrations of the oldest, continuous living cultures on earth.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Open House
item.description:
Saturday, July 13, 2024

City Hall will be lit Orange to celebrate Brisbane Open House.

Brisbane Open House (BOH) is a free annual event providing residents and visitors with the rare opportunity to discover the hidden wealth of architecture, engineering and history in buildings and places around Brisbane city. Selected buildings are open to the public with guided and self-guided tours encouraging visitors to explore, re-examine and engage with Brisbane’s built environment. The experience opens people’s eyes and minds to good design and curious spaces.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Open House Ltd.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Diabetes Week
item.description:
Monday, July 15, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Diabetes Week.

Diabetes Australia works to bring about change, by providing a national voice and leadership, while maintaining strong local community connections and engagement. National Diabetes Week (NDW) is one of Diabetes Australia’s flagship annual awareness campaigns held in the second week of July, 14 to 20 July 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Diabetes Australia.

item.title: State of Origin - Game III Brisbane
item.description:
Tuesday, July 16, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game III Brisbane.

We head to Suncorp Stadium for Game III of the Ampol State of Origin Series for 2024. Will the Queensland Maroons secure their third consecutive series win and will it go down to the wire. Let’s get behind our team as the play in their backyard.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency.

item.title: Eve of National Pyjama Day
item.description:
Thursday, July 18, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support Eve of National Pyjama Day.

The Pyjama Foundation provide children and young people in foster care the opportunity to change the direction of their lives with learning, life skills and confidence. Through our Love of Learning program, volunteers called 'Pyjama Angels' are recruited, screened, trained and then matched with a child in care and spend time with them once a week, focusing on learning-based activities. Pyjama Angels read books aloud with their child, play educational games and help children with their homework.

National Pyjama Day (officially held on Friday 19 July, 2024) is all about wearing your favourite pair of PJ's to help The Pyjama Foundation raise much-needed awareness and funds for children in foster care. With the money raised from National Pyjama Day, you’ll be helping us offer learning skills to more than 1000 children, fund educational resources and help provide stable, positive relationships.

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue Pink and White to support Eve of National Pyjama Day.
The Pyjama Foundation provide children and young people in foster care the opportunity to change the direction of their lives with learning, life skills and confidence. Through our Love of Learning program, volunteers called 'Pyjama Angels' are recruited, screened, trained and then matched with a child in care and spend time with them once a week, focusing on learning-based activities. Pyjama Angels read books aloud with their child, play educational games and help children with their homework.
National Pyjama Day (officially held on Friday 19 July, 2024) is all about wearing your favourite pair of PJ's to help The Pyjama Foundation raise much-needed awareness and funds for children in foster care. With the money raised from National Pyjama Day, you’ll be helping us offer learning skills to more than 1000 children, fund educational resources and help provide stable, positive relationships.
This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd.

item.title: Anywhere Fringe
item.description:
Friday, July 19, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate Anywhere Fringe.

Anywhere Festivals makes it possible for performance makers to create works anywhere and for audiences to engage with storytelling regardless of access to theatres and experience performances in their community. Anywhere Fringe Brisbane Festival is the fringe festival combining non traditional and traditional spaces across Brisbane from 19 July to 4 August 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Anywhere Festival.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Qld Reds vs Wales
item.description:
Friday, July 19, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to celebrate Qld Reds vs Wales.

Be there at Suncorp Stadium on Friday, 19 July 2024 as our Queensland Reds take on Wales in the first International Tour Match for over 20 years! The Wales match will be a grand revival of the rich history of Queensland sides facing international touring teams. It will be the first clash for the Reds against a major touring nation in two decades since they beat Scotland 41-5 at Ballymore Stadium in 2004.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
